title: Mexican Grand Prix 2019 RESULT: Latest updates as Lewis Hamilton tries for the F1 title today
text:
Lewis Hamilton has won the Mexican Grand Prix to put him within touching distance of his sixth world championship.

Following the third-place finish of Mercedes team-mate Valtteri Bottas, Hamilton needs just four more points at the United States Grand Prix next week to kick-start his title celebrations.

READ: The full race report from the Autodromo Hermanos Rodriguez circuit

Charles Leclerc starts on pole at the Mexican Grand Prix after fastest man Max Verstappen was demoted from the front row after his yellow flag infringement in qualifying.

Lewis Hamilton starts third as the British Mercedes driver targets a challenging but possible task of winning the F1 drivers' Championship today.

Hamilton requires to beat his team-mate Valtteri Bottas, who starts sixth on the grid, by 14 points or more.

Sportsmail's Dan Ripley will provide live F1 coverage of the Mexican GP from the Autodromo Hermanos Rodriguez circuit.
